meanings.definition: A tide just after a new or full moon, when there is the greatest difference between high and low water.
meanings.sent1: During springtides, the ocean's water level changes dramatically.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen are cautious during springtides due to the strong currents.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls seemed confused by the springtides, splashing around in the shallows.
meanings.sent4: The power of the springtides pulled the boats closer to the shore.
meanings.sent5: The roaring waves of the springtides were a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The season of the year between winter and summer, lasting from March to June in the Northern Hemisphere and from September to December in the Southern Hemisphere.
meanings.sent1: Springtides bring blooming flowers and warmer weather.
meanings.sent2: Many people enjoy outdoor activities during the springtides.
meanings.sent3: The animals in the forest were busy preparing for the springtides.
meanings.sent4: The springtides painted the landscape in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: Children eagerly anticipate the arrival of the springtides.
